Description: Small axe head made of greenish-grey stone with white inclusions, rounded triangular shape, tapered towards the butt, convex blade end. Front and back sides are smoothed. The blade end is very eroded and not sharp. A small area at the blade end is chipped off. The section is slightly curved, getting thinner towards the blade end.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), Area west of town, surface
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 158)
